head.title: Nancy N. Radin Is a Bride

hedline.hl1: Nancy N. Radin Is a Bride

block.p: LEAD: Nancy N. Radin and Jerome Tarnoff were married yesterday at the bride's home in New York by Rabbi David M. Posner. Mrs. Tarnoff, who was a widow, is a daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Arthur L. Newman of New York. She is a partner in the Paper Clip, a personalized stationery service in New York. The bridegroom, a son of Anne Tarnoff of Brooklyn and the late Meyer Tarnoff, is a senior partner in the New York law firm of Berger & Steingut.

LEAD: Nancy N. Radin and Jerome Tarnoff were married yesterday at the bride's home in New York by Rabbi David M. Posner. Mrs. Tarnoff, who was a widow, is a daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Arthur L. Newman of New York. She is a partner in the Paper Clip, a personalized stationery service in New York. The bridegroom, a son of Anne Tarnoff of Brooklyn and the late Meyer Tarnoff, is a senior partner in the New York law firm of Berger & Steingut.

Nancy N. Radin and Jerome Tarnoff were married yesterday at the bride's home in New York by Rabbi David M. Posner. Mrs. Tarnoff, who was a widow, is a daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Arthur L. Newman of New York. She is a partner in the Paper Clip, a personalized stationery service in New York. The bridegroom, a son of Anne Tarnoff of Brooklyn and the late Meyer Tarnoff, is a senior partner in the New York law firm of Berger & Steingut. He is the vice chairman of the New York County Democratic Committee and a trustee of the New York State Democratic Party. His first marriage ended in divorce.
